guideline.p: the system or system component requiring a process or processes to identify and address weaknesses or deficiencies is defined;

set-parameter.value: Business/System-defined system or system component (defined in applicable security/privacy plans)

set-parameter.label: supply chain personnel

guideline.p: supply chain personnel with whom to coordinate the process or processes to identify and address weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes is/are defined;

set-parameter.value: the CMS OIT, or designee, and the CMS CISO, or designee

set-parameter.label: frequency

guideline.p: the frequency at which to assess and review the supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors and the systems, system components, or system services they provide is defined;

set-parameter.value: every 365 days
notification of supply chain compromises, results of assessments or audits, and CMS information (defined in applicable security/privacy plans)
at random and/or every 365 days or upon indications of need for inspection

set-parameter.label: systems or system components

guideline.p: systems or system components that require inspection are defined;

set-parameter.value: CMS systems and system components (defined in applicable security/privacy plans)
the source of counterfeit component, the CMS CCIC, CISA, and CMS personnel or roles, e.g. CMS SCRM Manager (defined in applicable security/privacy plans and CMS IS2P2)

set-parameter.label: personnel or roles

guideline.p: personnel or roles requiring training to detect counterfeit system components (including hardware, software, and firmware) is/are defined;

set-parameter.value: all System Engineers, ISSOs, System Owners and other System POCs as well CMS personnel or roles (defined in CMS IS2P2 and/or in applicable security/privacy plans)

set-parameter.label: frequency

guideline.p: the frequency at which to scan for counterfeit system components is defined;

set-parameter.value: no less often than every 365 days
